pullRequest.body:
This PR adds several lemmas about the interaction between the (non-unital) CFC and `algebraMap`. Several lemmas require some sort of nontriviality statement for the CFC (i.e. the predicate can't be false everywhere), I just stated it as an `hp : p 0` hypothesis in the lemma statements; it seems like the most convenient way in practice and probably the easiest to automate.

Co-authored-by: Jireh Loreaux <loreaujy@gmail.com>

---

- [x] depends on: #14100

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

Can you namespace the ones that don't have `cfc` to the `CFC` namespace? (including the few lemmas above that you didn't write)

It's strange to have `spectrum_zero_eq` for example, in the root namespace, with a `ContinuousFunctionalCalculus` hypothesis, especially when we have `spectrum.zero_eq` already.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(ContinuousFunctionalCalculus): add several lemmas involving the CFC and `algebraMap`
